sentences.translation: I hear you’ve been feeling depressed.
How long have you been depressed?

sentences.transcription: Xïni̠-i ra.  Átu xa̠ íyo u̠ni̠ yo̠ó va ndó'o-i saá.
sentences.translation: I don’t know.  I’ve been feeling this way for, say, three months.

sentences.transcription: Á kökûni̠-un kitá'án-un xí'in na̠ tá'án-un á na̠ sáchíñu xí'in-un chi ra kúta̠ti ini va kúú-un?
sentences.translation: Do you find that you don’t want to spend time with your relatives or your coworkers because you feel too glum?

sentences.transcription: Saá ndó’o-i xí'in na̠ ve'e-i.  Kösáchíñu-i vichin.
sentences.translation: That’s how I feel with my family.  I’m not working now.

sentences.transcription: Tá ká'a̠n-na xí'in-un ku̠'u̠n-un xí'in-na kaka nuu-ndo á kútóo-un kana-un ku̠'u̠n-un xí'in-na á kûni̠-un kindo̠o-un ve'e?
sentences.translation: When you’re invited to hang out do you like to get out and do things or do you find that you just want to stay home?
I just want to stay home.
Sometimes I want to kill myself.

sentences.transcription: Á nda̠kani ini-un na̠xa ka'ní-un mií-un?
sentences.translation: Have you contemplated how you would kill yourself?

sentences.transcription: Xi̠ndá'vi ini-un nda̠tú'un-un xí'in-i xa̠'á-ña ndó'o-un.  Vichin ka̠'a̠n-yo xa̠'á-ña na̠xa kuvi nduva̠'a-un.
sentences.translation: Thank you for talking with me about what you are going through.  Now we will talk about some treatment options to help you get better.
